DataElement.preferredName: Biospecimen Gross Pathologic Examination Room To Tissue Bank Transfer Time
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The time at which the specimen was transferred from the pathology gross room to the tissue bank specified in military format.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Biospecimen Gross Pathologic Examination Room To Tissue Bank Transfer
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._An assessment of macroscopic pathological findings that are caused by disease._An area within a building enclosed by walls and floor and ceiling._Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement._A repository of the tissue specimen, cells or cell lines, for experimental purpose. It can be from different diseases or different parts of the body._The act of conveying or transporting from one place to another.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Concepts.definition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Property.preferredName: Gross Pathologic Examination Room To Tissue Collection Transfer

Concepts.definition: An assessment of macroscopic pathological findings that are caused by disease.
An area within a building enclosed by walls and floor and ceiling.
Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.
A repository of the tissue specimen, cells or cell lines, for experimental purpose. It can be from different diseases or different parts of the body.
The act of conveying or transporting from one place to another.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Concepts linked to Tissue Banking and Pathology activities

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: the time at which an event was observed or occurred.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Time is the continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.

Concepts.definition: The continuum of experience in which events pass from the future through the present to the past.
